column2: UTAH DMV TEST
Question Text
1. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column10: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.

column2: 2. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 3. On two-lane, two-way streets or highways, you should start left turns close to the center line.
4. BAC is expressed in:
column4: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 5. What does this sign indicate?
6. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column10: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column2: 7. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.

9. This road sign means:
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

11. A flashing red light means:
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 12. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

14. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column6: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column8: watch for this species crossing the road.
column10: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.

column2: 15. Vertical panels, barricades, drums and cones are the most commonly used devices to guide drivers safely through work zones.

17. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column6: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column8: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column10: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.

column2: 18. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column10: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.

column2: 19. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: stay in the center of your lane
column8: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 20. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column8: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 21. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column8: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.

column2: 22. When driving through a work zone you should:
column6: slow down and pay extra attention.
column8: pull over to the right side of the road and stop.
column10: keep a 2-second following distance behind the vehicle in front.

column2: 23. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column10: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column6: Right turn permitted on red light
